properties.name: Barringer Crater
properties.description: Posted by Kthoma26Nice side attraction just east of Flagstaff, Arizona. The crater is roughly a mile wide and almost 600 feet deep. Not a whole lot to do there but it is a sight that not many get to experience. Drop by if you are in the area.

properties.name: Garden City Beach
properties.description: Posted by Kthoma26  A normal family trip for my dads side of the family. Not the prettiest beaches and not a whole lot to do. But if rest and relaxation is what you want then you\'ve come to the right place.

properties.name: Glacier National Park
properties.description: Posted by Kthoma26 Glacier national park was an incredible experience. In the middle of the summer the weather was still cool and the wind was always brisk. Seeing the glaciers was special because they won\'t be here much longer at the rate they are melting. My family and I made the trip up here after spending some time in Yellowstone National Park.

properties.name: Grand Canyon North Rim
properties.description: Posted by Kthoma26This is a park located on the north rim of the Grand Canyon. The north rim is special because of all the visitors each year the north rim only hosts 10% of them. I came here 5 or 6 years back with my family and stayed 2 weeks and it was one of my most memorable vacations.

properties.name: Hilton Head
properties.description: Posted by Kthoma26This is the standard vacation destination for my mom\'s side of the family and like most family beaches it is fairly boring. The sand is nicer than most beaches north of it but still not my favorite location.

properties.name: Hoover Dam
properties.description: Posted by Kthoma26Just one of the sight seeing stops my family and I made on one of our treks out west. The scorching heat is my main memory because the temperature was a scorching 125 degrees in some spots on the dam. If you have time it\'s an interesting structure that boggles the mind with it\'s immense size.

properties.name: Kiger's Campground
properties.description: Posted by Kthoma263725 maryville pike knoxville tennesseeA place to camp that is right down the road. The great aspect about this place is the fact that it is right on the water and doesn\'t require a long drive to get to it. The surroundings are nice and there is a decent amount of wildlife around. Don\'t forget your fishing pole when you come here because some decent size catfish have been plucked from these waters.

properties.name: MT Rushmore National Memorial
properties.description: Posted by Kthoma2613000 Highway 244, Keystone, SDAnother attraction worth seeing. It is hard to imagine how big the monument really is without seeing it in person. I was simply amazed by the dedication and time that it took to construct this.

properties.name: Mt. Leconte
properties.description: Posted by Kthoma26Great place to hike up to and stay the night but requires reservations to be made more than a year in advance. You can hike up to the top on your own and not stay at the lodge overnight but then you are forced to come back down the same day. Overall a very worthwhile adventure.

properties.name: Ocoee River Rafting
properties.description: Posted by Kthoma264651 Hwy 64, Copperhill, TN 37317White water rafting at it\'s best, at least as my limited experience goes. This was an awesome day long adventure that left me wanting to do it again and again. If an adrenaline rush is what you seek then this is definitely for you.

properties.name: PANAMA CITY
properties.description: Posted by Kthoma26Obviously a favorite spring break destination for teens and it didn\'t let me down either. My friends and I had a great time on our senior year spring break trip down there. It was a constant party with stuff always going on. This place comes highly recommended.

properties.name: The Badlands
properties.description: Posted by Kthoma26Similar to the Grand Canyon but not nearly as big. The landscape is mesmerizing and seems to go on and on forever.

properties.name: Yellowstone National Park
properties.description: Posted by Kthoma26 One of my all time favorite trips. On this vacation we visited several locations in the west and almost ventured up to Canada when we made our way up to Glacier National. The terrain and geyseyers here are awesome and if you can handle the sulfur smell that vents out of the earth then you will thoroughly enjoy this place.
